definition: spot/point/dot/speck/drop (of liquid)/droplet/point (of argument)/idea/crux/indication/pointer

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
to express an opinion/to offer advice
trickery/scam
illegal device/devious/crooked
(coll.) to have a stroke of bad luck
drum beat/rhythm

sentences.english: The best ideas have to win, otherwise you don’t have good people who stay.
sentences.chinese: 最棒的点子总会胜出，除非你身边的都是些庸才。

sentences.english: Computers let you try out different styles and ideas.
sentences.chinese: 电脑能让你尝试不同的风格和点子。

sentences.english: Rachel has some great ideas for packing and organizing kids stuff for a trip.
sentences.chinese: 雷切尔在关于给孩子旅行装包方面有着很伟大的点子。

sentences.english: You can’t have good ideas unless you’re willing to generate a lot of bad ones.
sentences.chinese: 除非摒弃诸多不良想法才会有好点子。

sentences.english: I often wake up with a new idea.
sentences.chinese: 一觉醒来就会想到一个新点子。

sentences.english: Sometimes the best ideas come to us when we're not focused on finding the best ideas.
sentences.chinese: 有时候一些金点子都是在我们不经意间突发灵感的。

sentences.english: We can talk about you idea later, but now lets get back to our muttons .
sentences.chinese: 我们以后再谈你的点子，现在咱们言归正传。

sentences.english: This kind of examination can produce dozens of new ideas.
sentences.chinese: 这类检查可以产生数以十计的新点子。

sentences.english: Where there is a demand for innovative ideas Barski Design develops new perspectives for its clients.
sentences.chinese: 巴斯克设计还为客户提供创新的设计点子。

sentences.english: Export positions in pips as a spreadsheet.
sentences.chinese: 出口职位点子作为一个电子表格。

sentences.english: You sit down the night before and you had a couple of ideas.
sentences.chinese: 交论文前一晚终于坐下来，有几个点子。

sentences.english: Often architects use smaller commissions as testing grounds for new ideas.
sentences.chinese: 通常建筑师会将较小的项目作为新点子的试验田。

sentences.english: The stone respects once smoke hike, two princesses urgently ask her to have what specter idea.
sentences.chinese: 石敬云一走，两公主就急问她有什么鬼点子了。

sentences.english: I felt golden ideas pouring from the dark blue sky.
sentences.chinese: 我感受到金光闪闪的点子从深蓝色的夜幕倾泻而下。

sentences.english: Let's brainstorm and see if we can come up with some new ideas.
sentences.chinese: 让我们脑力激荡一下看看能不能有新点子。

definition: to figure out/to work out (a solution etc)/to think up/to come up with (an idea etc)
plan/idea/decision/CL:個|个[ge4]/Beijing pr. [zhu2 yi5]
to imagine the wildest thing/to indulge in fantasy
way/method/Taiwan pr. [fa2 zi5]
way of thinking/opinion/notion/to think of a way (to do sth)/CL:個|个[ge4]
a bright idea suddenly occurs (idiom); to hit upon an inspiration/to be struck by a brainwave
collecting opinions is of wide benefit (idiom); to pool wisdom for mutual benefit/to profit from widespread suggestions
quick witted/able to think fast in an emergency
brains/mind/head/way of thinking
to express an opinion/to offer advice
like a heavenly steed, soaring across the skies (idiom)/(of writing, calligraphy etc) bold and imaginative/unconstrained in style
to rack one's brains
move (in chess, on stage, in martial arts)/gambit/trick/scheme/movement/same as 著數|着数[zhao1 shu4]
suddenly have a thought (idiom)/suddenly be inspired to do something
to use one's brains/to think
brains
